DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Bevacizumab Most Recent Treatment Regimen Progression Or Recurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient has experienced progression or recurrece while on bevacizumab as the most recent treatment regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Bevacizumab Most Recent Treatment Regimen Progression Or Recurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels._Nearest to the present._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The worsening of a disease over time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Bevacizumab Most Recent Treatment Regimen Disease Progression Or Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm
Property.preferredDefinition: A drug used to treat several types of cancer, including certain types of colorectal, lung, breast, and kidney cancers and glioblastoma. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer. Avastin binds to vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and may prevent the growth of new blood vessels that tumors need to grow. It is a type of antiangiogenesis agent and a type of monoclonal antibody.:Nearest to the present.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:The worsening of a disease over time.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
